code: @Manual{,   title = {arthistory: Art History Textbook Data},   author = {Sara Lemus and Holland Stam},   year = {2022},   note = {https://github.com/saralemus7/arthistory, https://saralemus7.github.io/arthistory/}, }

title: Art History Textbook Data
text: package contains data used Holland Stam’s thesis work, titled Quantifying art historical narratives. data collected assess demographic representation artists editions Janson’s History Art Gardner’s Art Ages, two popular art history textbooks used American education system. package specifically, artist-level work-level data collected along variables regarding artists’ demographics numeric metrics describing much space work took edition textbook.

title: Art History Textbook Data
text: can install development version arthistory GitHub :

title: Art History Textbook Data
text: package contains three datasets: worksjanson: Contains individual work-level data edition Gardner’s art history textbook 1963 2011. work, information size work text displayed textbook well details work’s medium year created. Demographic data artist also included. worksgardner: Contains individual work-level data edition Gardner’s art history textbook 1926 2020. work, information size work displayed textbook well size accompanying descriptive text. Demographic data artist also included. artists: Contains various information artists edition Gardner Janson’s art history textbook 1926 2020. Data includes demographic information, space occupied textbook, well presence MoMA Whitney museums.

text: Artists edition Gardner Janson's art history textbook

title: Artists by edition of Gardner or Janson's art history textbook — artists
Artists by edition of Gardner or Janson's art history textbook — artists
text: data frame 3,162 observations 14 variables. artist_name name artist. edition_number number edition either Gardner's Art Ages Janson's History Art. year year publication. artist_nationality nationaliity artist. artist_nationality_other nationality artist. total count artists editions Gardner's Art Ages Janson's History Art, 77.32% account French, Spanish, British, American German. Therefore, categorical strings variable French, Spanish, British, American, German . artist_gender gender artist. artist_race race artist. artist_ethnicity ethnicity artist. book book, either Janson Gardner particular artist particular time included. space_ratio_per_page_total area centimeters squared text figure particular artist given edition Janson's History Art Gardner's Art Ages divided area centimeters squared single page respective edition. artist_unique_id unique identifying number assigned artists across books editions denoted alphabetical order. moma_count_to_year count exhibitions held Museum Modern Art (MoMA) particular artist particular moment time, highlighted year. whitney_count_to_year count exhibitions held Whitney particular artist particular moment time, highlighted year. artist_race_nwi non-white indicator artist race, meaning artist's race denoted either white non-white.

title: Artists by edition of Gardner or Janson's art history textbook — artists
text: Stam, H. (2022). Quantifying art historical narratives. doi:10.7924/r4dn48h0w . Duke Research Data Repository.

title: Artists by edition of Gardner or Janson's art history textbook — artists
code: library(ggplot2) library(dplyr) #>  #> Attaching package: ‘dplyr’ #> The following objects are masked from ‘package:stats’: #>  #>     filter, lag #> The following objects are masked from ‘package:base’: #>  #>     intersect, setdiff, setequal, union  artists %>% ggplot(aes(y = book , fill = artist_gender))+  geom_bar()+  labs(    title = "Gender by Book",    x = "Count of Artists",    y = "Book",    fill = "Artist Gender")

Works of art from Gardner’s Art Through the Ages from 1926 until 2020 — worksgardner
text: data frame 2,325 observations 24 variables. artist_name name given artist given edition Gardner's Art Ages created two-dimensional work c. 1750. edition_number number edition Gardner's Art Ages. title_of_work title work listed .Gardner's Art Ages publication_year year publication. page_number_of_image page number figure image text. artist_unique_id unique number assigned artist included Gardner's Art Ages created two-dimensional work c. 1750. artist_nationality nationaliity artist. artist_gender gender artist. artist_race race artist. artist_ethnicity ethnicity artist. height_of_work_in_book height centimeters figure work book . width_of_work_in_book width centimeters figure work book . height_of_text height centimeters text written given work given artist given edition. width_of_text width centimeters text written given work given artist given edition. extra_text_height height centimeters extra text written text work artist rectangular shape. extra_text_width width centimeters extra text written text work artist rectangular shape. area_of_work_in_book area centimeters squared work text. area_of_text area centimeters squared written work text. extra_text_area extra area centimeters squared written work rectangular text. total_area_text total area centimeters squared written given work. total_space area work centimeters squared plus area text centimeters squared given particular work. page_area area centimeters squared page given edition Gardner's Art Ages. space_ratio_per_page total space centimeters squared divided area page given edition. book name book,Gardner's Art Ages, gardner short.

title: Works of art from Gardner’s Art Through the Ages from 1926 until 2020 — worksgardner
text: Stam, H. (2022). Quantifying art historical narratives. doi:10.7924/r4dn48h0w . Duke Research Data Repository.

title: Works of art from Gardner’s Art Through the Ages from 1926 until 2020 — worksgardner
code: library(ggplot2) library(dplyr)  worksgardner %>%   filter(artist_name == "Pablo Picasso") %>%   ggplot(aes(x = publication_year)) +   geom_bar() +   labs(     title = "Count of Works by Pablo Picasso Through Editions of     Gardner's Art Through the Ages",     x = "Year",     y = "Number of Works by Picasso"     )

text: data frame 1,634 observations 25 variables. artist_name name given artist given edition Janson's Art Ages created two-dimensional work c. 1750. artist_unique_id unique number assigned artist included Janson's History Art created two-dimensional work c. 1750. artist_nationality nationaliity artist. artist_gender gender artist. artist_race race artist. artist_ethnicity ethnicity artist. title_of_work title work listed .Janson's History Art edition_number number edition Janson's History Art. publication_year year publication. part_in_text number part text. case, every work part 4, "Modern World." chapter_title title chapter given work . start_date year artist began creating work. end_date year artist finished work. circa 1 date work labeled circa (around) 0 date work labeled circa medium medium work. height_of_work_in_book height centimeters work given edition Janson's History Art width_of_work_in_book width centimeters work given edition Janson's History Art height_of_text height text centimeters text written work given edition Janson's History Art width_of_text width text centimeters text written work given edition Janson's History Art area_actual_work area centimeters squared actual work . area_of_work_in_book area centimeter's squared given work given edition Janson's History Art area_of_text area centimeter's squared text given work given edition Janson's History Art work_to_figure_ratio size actual work divided size work book work_in_text_in_color figure work Janson's History Art color, denoted 1, figure work color, denoted 0. location_as_catalogued_in_janson location work catalogued given edition Janson's History Art.
